title: Sprint Analysis Report
content:
Analyze the current Jira sprint and provide a comprehensive status report:

1. Get the active sprint from the board using jira_get_sprints_from_board
2. Fetch all issues in the sprint using jira_get_sprint_issues
3. Categorize issues by status (To Do, In Progress, Done, Blocked)
4. Calculate completion percentage and velocity

Please provide:
- Total story points committed vs completed
- Issues at risk of not completing (still in To Do or blocked)
- Team workload distribution by assignee
- Recommendations for sprint success

Board URL: [PASTE_BOARD_URL]
description: Comprehensive sprint health analysis for status reporting

title: Daily Standup Preparation
content:
Prepare daily standup information from Jira:

1. Search for my assigned issues in the current sprint
2. Identify what I completed yesterday (status changed to Done in last 24h)
3. List what I'm working on today (status = In Progress)
4. Flag any blockers or dependencies

Format the output as:
**DONE YESTERDAY:**
- [List completed items]

**WORKING ON TODAY:**
- [List in-progress items]

**BLOCKERS:**
- [List any blockers or help needed]

Board URL: [PASTE_BOARD_URL]
description: Generate standup notes from Jira sprint data

title: Ticket Quality Assessment
content:
Review this Jira ticket for completeness and testability:

1. Use jira_get_issue to fetch full ticket details
2. Evaluate the acceptance criteria clarity (1-10 scale)
3. Check for missing information:
   - User story format (As a... I want... So that...)
   - Acceptance criteria
   - Technical details or constraints
   - Edge cases mentioned
   - Test scenarios suggested
4. Suggest improvements for better testability

Ticket URL: [PASTE_TICKET_URL]
description: Assess Jira ticket quality for QA refinement preparation

title: Code Review Checklist Generator
content:
Generate a code review checklist based on this Jira ticket:

1. Use jira_get_issue to fetch the full ticket description and acceptance criteria
2. Create a checklist covering:
   - Functional requirements from acceptance criteria
   - Unit test coverage requirements
   - Security considerations (input validation, auth, etc.)
   - Performance implications
   - Documentation needs
   - Edge cases to verify
   - API contract compliance (if applicable)

Ticket URL: [PASTE_TICKET_URL]
description: Generate comprehensive code review checklist from ticket requirements

title: Development Estimation Assistant
content:
Help estimate development effort for this Jira ticket:

1. Use jira_get_issue to analyze the ticket scope
2. Break down the work into components:
   - Backend changes
   - Frontend changes
   - Database migrations
   - API changes
   - Testing effort
3. Consider complexity factors and provide story point recommendation
4. Identify potential risks that could affect the estimate

Ticket URL: [PASTE_TICKET_URL]
description: Assist with story point estimation based on ticket analysis

title: Sprint Goals Summary
content:
Summarize the current sprint goals and progress:

1. Get sprint details using jira_get_sprints_from_board
2. Analyze the sprint goal/description
3. Map completed features to business value
4. Identify what's still needed to meet the sprint goal
5. Prepare stakeholder communication summary

Board URL: [PASTE_BOARD_URL]
description: Create sprint goal summary for stakeholder communication

title: Bug Triage Assistant
content:
Help triage and prioritize this bug report:

1. Use jira_get_issue to fetch bug details
2. Assess severity based on:
   - User impact (critical, major, minor, cosmetic)
   - Affected functionality scope
   - Workaround availability
   - Security implications
3. Suggest priority level (P1-P4)
4. Recommend next steps and potential assignee

Bug Ticket: [PASTE_TICKET_URL]
description: Systematic bug triage and prioritization

title: Sprint Retrospective Data
content:
Gather data for sprint retrospective:

1. Get completed sprint issues using jira_get_sprint_issues
2. Analyze:
   - Planned vs delivered story points
   - Carryover items and reasons
   - Bug count introduced vs fixed
   - Cycle time patterns
3. Identify patterns for discussion:
   - What went well (completed on time, quality)
   - What could improve (delays, blockers)
   - Action items from data

Board URL: [PASTE_BOARD_URL]
description: Generate retrospective insights from sprint data

title: Release Scope Documentation
content:
Document the scope of an upcoming release:

1. Search for all issues with the target fixVersion
2. Group by epic/feature area
3. Create release scope document with:
   - Feature list with descriptions
   - Known limitations or deferred items
   - Dependencies on external systems
   - Rollback considerations
4. Format for stakeholder review

Project Key: [PROJECT_KEY]
Fix Version: [VERSION]
description: Create release scope documentation from Jira issues

title: Team Workload Distribution
content:
Analyze team workload distribution:

1. Get all issues in current sprint using jira_get_sprint_issues
2. Calculate per-person metrics:
   - Story points assigned
   - Issue count by type (story, bug, task)
   - Time in current status
3. Identify:
   - Overloaded team members
   - Available capacity
   - Potential bottlenecks
4. Suggest workload rebalancing if needed

Board URL: [PASTE_BOARD_URL]
description: Analyze and balance team workload across sprint

title: Release Notes Generator
content:
Generate release notes from completed work:

1. Search Jira for completed issues in this release version
2. Group changes by category:
   - New Features
   - Improvements
   - Bug Fixes
   - Technical Changes
3. Write user-friendly descriptions (not technical jargon)
4. Use confluence_create_page to publish release notes with:
   - Version number and release date
   - Highlights section
   - Detailed change list
   - Known issues
   - Upgrade instructions (if applicable)

Project: [PROJECT_KEY]
Version: [VERSION]
Space Key: [CONFLUENCE_SPACE]
description: Create and publish release notes to Confluence

title: Meeting Notes Template
content:
Create structured meeting notes in Confluence:

1. Use confluence_create_page with this structure:
   - Meeting Title and Date
   - Attendees
   - Agenda Items
   - Discussion Summary (per agenda item)
   - Decisions Made
   - Action Items (with owners and due dates)
   - Next Meeting Date
2. Link to relevant Jira tickets or other Confluence pages mentioned
3. Tag relevant stakeholders

Space Key: [CONFLUENCE_SPACE]
Meeting Topic: [TOPIC]
description: Create standardized meeting documentation in Confluence

title: Project Handover Documentation
content:
Create a comprehensive project handover document:

1. Gather information from Jira board and existing Confluence pages
2. Document:
   - Project overview and goals
   - Current status and progress
   - Key stakeholders and contacts
   - Technical architecture summary
   - Important decisions made (with rationale)
   - Open items and risks
   - Access and credentials needed
   - Regular meetings and ceremonies
3. Create or update Confluence page with handover guide

Project: [PROJECT_NAME]
Space Key: [CONFLUENCE_SPACE]
description: Generate comprehensive project handover documentation

title: Architecture Decision Record
content:
Create an Architecture Decision Record (ADR):

1. Use confluence_create_page with ADR template:
   - Title: ADR-XXX: [Decision Title]
   - Status: Proposed/Accepted/Deprecated/Superseded
   - Context: Why this decision is needed
   - Decision: What was decided
   - Alternatives Considered: Other options evaluated
   - Consequences: Impact of this decision
   - Related Documents: Links to relevant pages
2. Link to related ADRs if this supersedes previous decisions

Space Key: [CONFLUENCE_SPACE]
Decision Topic: [TOPIC]
description: Document architecture decisions in standardized ADR format

title: Knowledge Base Search
content:
Search the Confluence knowledge base:

1. Use confluence_search with relevant keywords
2. Summarize top matching pages:
   - Page title and link
   - Key content summary
   - Last updated date
   - Author/owner
3. Identify knowledge gaps if search yields poor results
4. Suggest related topics to explore

Search Topic: [TOPIC]
Space Key (optional): [SPACE]
description: Search and summarize relevant Confluence documentation

title: Merge Request Code Review
content:
Perform a comprehensive code review of this merge request:

1. Get MR details using gitlab_get_merge_request
2. Review all changes using gitlab_get_merge_request_changes
3. Evaluate:
   - Code style and consistency
   - Test coverage for new/changed code
   - Security considerations (SQL injection, XSS, auth)
   - Performance implications
   - Documentation updates needed
   - Breaking changes or API contract compliance
4. Provide constructive feedback with specific line references
5. Summarize: Approve, Request Changes, or Comment

MR URL: [PASTE_MR_URL]
description: Thorough code review workflow for merge requests

title: Pipeline Failure Analysis
content:
Debug this failing GitLab pipeline:

1. Get pipeline status using gitlab_get_pipeline
2. Identify failed jobs using gitlab_get_pipeline_jobs
3. Analyze error logs using gitlab_get_job_trace
4. Diagnose the failure:
   - Is it a code issue, configuration issue, or infrastructure issue?
   - Are dependencies properly installed?
   - Are environment variables set correctly?
   - Is it a flaky test?
5. Suggest specific fixes and next steps
6. Recommend if gitlab_retry_job would help

Pipeline URL: [PASTE_PIPELINE_URL]
description: Diagnose and resolve CI/CD pipeline failures

title: Open Merge Requests Overview
content:
Review all open merge requests for the team:

1. List all open MRs in the repository
2. For each MR, summarize:
   - Title and author
   - Target branch
   - Age (days open)
   - Review status (approved, changes requested, pending)
   - Pipeline status
3. Identify:
   - Stale MRs (open > 7 days)
   - MRs blocked on reviews
   - MRs with failing pipelines
4. Suggest prioritization for review

Repository: [REPO_PATH]
description: Overview of open merge requests requiring attention

title: Security-Focused Code Review
content:
Perform a security-focused review of this merge request:

1. Get MR changes using gitlab_get_merge_request_changes
2. Check for security vulnerabilities:
   - Input validation and sanitization
   - SQL injection risks
   - XSS vulnerabilities
   - Authentication/authorization issues
   - Sensitive data exposure
   - Insecure dependencies
   - Hardcoded secrets or credentials
3. Rate severity of any findings (Critical, High, Medium, Low)
4. Provide remediation suggestions for each finding

MR URL: [PASTE_MR_URL]
description: Security audit of merge request changes

title: Release Changelog Generation
content:
Generate a changelog from merged MRs:

1. List all merged MRs between two tags/branches
2. Categorize by:
   - Features (feat:, feature:)
   - Bug Fixes (fix:, bugfix:)
   - Improvements (improve:, perf:)
   - Documentation (docs:)
   - Breaking Changes (BREAKING:)
3. Format as Markdown changelog
4. Include MR references and authors

Repository: [REPO_PATH]
From: [TAG_OR_BRANCH]
To: [TAG_OR_BRANCH]
description: Generate changelog from merged merge requests

title: Lead Qualification Workflow
content:
Qualify a new sales lead:

1. Use c4c_get_lead to fetch lead details
2. Evaluate against BANT criteria:
   - Budget: Does the prospect have budget?
   - Authority: Are we talking to decision makers?
   - Need: Is there a genuine business need?
   - Timeline: What is the expected decision timeline?
3. Score the lead (Hot, Warm, Cold)
4. Use c4c_update_lead to set qualification status
5. If qualified, recommend creating opportunity with c4c_create_opportunity

Lead ID: [LEAD_ID]
description: Structured BANT lead qualification process

title: Sales Pipeline Analysis
content:
Review the current sales pipeline:

1. Use c4c_search_opportunities to get all open opportunities
2. Analyze by sales phase:
   - Qualification
   - Discovery
   - Proposal
   - Negotiation
   - Closing
3. Calculate:
   - Total pipeline value
   - Weighted forecast (value x probability)
   - Average deal size
   - Expected close dates
4. Identify:
   - Deals at risk (stalled, past expected close)
   - High-value opportunities needing attention
   - Pipeline coverage vs target

Provide executive summary with key metrics.
description: Sales pipeline analysis and forecasting

title: Account Research Summary
content:
Research and summarize an account:

1. Use c4c_get_account to fetch account details
2. Use c4c_search_opportunities to find related opportunities
3. Use c4c_search_contacts to list key contacts
4. Compile account overview:
   - Company profile
   - Relationship history
   - Current opportunities
   - Key contacts and roles
   - Recent activities
   - Revenue potential
5. Identify upsell/cross-sell opportunities

Account ID: [ACCOUNT_ID]
description: Comprehensive account research for sales preparation

title: Contact Update Workflow
content:
Manage and update contact information:

1. Use c4c_get_contact to review current contact details
2. Verify and update:
   - Job title and department
   - Contact information
   - Account association
   - Role in buying process
3. Use c4c_update_contact to save changes
4. Log activity for audit trail

Contact ID: [CONTACT_ID]
Updates: [DESCRIBE_UPDATES]
description: Maintain accurate contact records in CRM

title: Weekly Time Report
content:
Generate weekly time tracking summary:

1. Use projektron_get_worklog for the current week (Monday to Sunday)
2. Summarize:
   - Total hours logged per day
   - Hours by project/task
   - Comparison to target hours (e.g., 40h/week)
3. Identify:
   - Days with missing entries
   - Projects with significant time investment
   - Overtime or undertime
4. Format as a clean weekly report

Date Range: [START_DATE] to [END_DATE]
description: Review and validate weekly time tracking entries

title: Team Availability Check
content:
Check team availability for planning:

1. Use projektron_get_absences for the specified period
2. Create availability overview:
   - Who is available when
   - Vacation and leave overlap
   - Coverage gaps
3. Identify critical periods with low availability
4. Suggest backup assignments for key responsibilities

Team Members: [LIST_MEMBERS]
Date Range: [START_DATE] to [END_DATE]
description: Plan around team absences and vacation schedules

title: Time Booking Assistant
content:
Help book time to the correct tasks:

1. Use projektron_get_all_tasks to list available bookable tasks
2. Match activities to appropriate tasks based on:
   - Project name
   - Task description
   - Activity type (development, meeting, admin)
3. Use projektron_add_worklog to book time
4. Confirm booking details

Date: [DATE]
Hours: [HOURS]
Activity Description: [WHAT_YOU_WORKED_ON]
description: Assist with booking time to correct project tasks

title: SharePoint Document Search
content:
Search for documents in SharePoint:

1. Use sharepoint_search with relevant keywords
2. Filter by:
   - Document type (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, PDF)
   - Site or library
   - Date range
3. Summarize top results:
   - Document title and location
   - Last modified date
   - Key content summary
4. Provide direct links to relevant documents

Search Query: [KEYWORDS]
Site (optional): [SITE_NAME]
description: Search and retrieve documents from SharePoint

title: Knowledge Base Query
content:
Query the SharePoint knowledge base:

1. Search for relevant content using keywords
2. Extract and synthesize information from multiple sources
3. Provide:
   - Summary of findings
   - Source documents with links
   - Confidence level in the information
   - Gaps in available documentation
4. Suggest related topics to explore

Topic: [TOPIC]
description: Extract knowledge from SharePoint document repository

title: Generate PDF Status Report
content:
Create a professional PDF status report:

1. Gather relevant data from connected integrations (Jira, etc.)
2. Structure the report:
   - Executive Summary
   - Key Metrics and KPIs
   - Progress Overview (charts/tables)
   - Risks and Issues
   - Next Steps and Action Items
3. Format in Markdown with clear sections
4. Use generate_and_upload_pdf to create the PDF
5. Return the download link for distribution

Report Title: [TITLE]
Data Sources: [DESCRIBE_DATA_NEEDED]
description: Generate downloadable PDF project reports

title: Generate PowerPoint Presentation
content:
Create a PowerPoint presentation:

1. Define the presentation structure:
   - Title slide
   - Agenda/Overview
   - Content slides (one topic per slide)
   - Summary/Next Steps
2. Use generate_pptx to create slides with:
   - Clear headings
   - Bullet points (max 5 per slide)
   - Key data points
3. Return the download link

Presentation Topic: [TOPIC]
Key Points: [LIST_KEY_POINTS]
description: Create professional PowerPoint presentations

title: Web Research Assistant
content:
Conduct web research on a topic:

1. Use web_search to find relevant information
2. Cross-reference multiple sources for accuracy
3. Compile research findings:
   - Key insights and facts
   - Source URLs with citations
   - Conflicting information (if any)
   - Confidence level assessment
4. Provide actionable recommendations based on findings

Research Topic: [TOPIC]
Focus Areas: [SPECIFIC_QUESTIONS]
description: Research and synthesize web information

title: Team Skills Matrix
content:
Build a team skills inventory:

1. Use employee_query to find team members
2. For each team member, gather:
   - Technical skills
   - Certifications
   - Project experience
   - Language skills
3. Create a skills matrix showing:
   - Skill coverage across team
   - Expertise levels
   - Training needs/gaps
4. Identify areas needing additional resources

Team/Department: [TEAM_NAME]
description: Map team competencies and identify skill gaps

title: Find Expert Colleague
content:
Find a colleague with specific expertise:

1. Use employee_query to search for skills/experience
2. Filter by:
   - Technical expertise
   - Project experience
   - Certifications
   - Availability
3. Provide candidate profiles:
   - Name and contact
   - Relevant experience
   - Current project involvement
4. Suggest best matches for the requirement

Required Skills: [SKILLS]
Project Type: [PROJECT_CONTEXT]
description: Find team members with specific skills or experience

title: Upcoming Company Events
content:
Check upcoming company events:

1. Use fetch_valantic_events to retrieve event calendar
2. Filter by:
   - Date range
   - Event type (training, social, conference)
   - Relevance to your role/team
3. Summarize key events:
   - Event name and date
   - Description
   - Registration requirements
   - Relevance to current projects

Date Range: [START_DATE] to [END_DATE]
description: View and filter upcoming company events

title: Competitor Analysis
content:
Research competitor information:

1. Use web_search to gather competitor intelligence
2. Analyze:
   - Product/service offerings
   - Market positioning
   - Recent news and announcements
   - Strengths and weaknesses
3. Compare to our offerings
4. Identify competitive advantages and threats
5. Format as executive summary

Competitor: [COMPANY_NAME]
Focus Areas: [SPECIFIC_ASPECTS]
description: Gather and analyze competitor intelligence

title: Document Summary
content:
Summarize an uploaded document:

1. Read the uploaded file content
2. Extract:
   - Main topic and purpose
   - Key points (bullet list)
   - Important data or metrics
   - Action items or recommendations
3. Provide concise summary (1-2 paragraphs)
4. Highlight anything requiring attention

File: [UPLOAD_FILE]
description: Extract and summarize key information from documents

title: Deployment Checklist Generator
content:
Generate a deployment checklist:

1. Based on the changes in this release, create checklist for:
   - Pre-deployment verification
   - Backup procedures
   - Deployment steps
   - Post-deployment validation
   - Rollback procedures
2. Include:
   - Database migrations
   - Configuration changes
   - Cache clearing
   - Service restarts
   - Health checks
3. Assign responsibilities for each step

Release Version: [VERSION]
Environment: [ENV]
description: Create comprehensive deployment checklist

title: Test Case Generator
content:
Generate test cases from requirements:

1. Analyze the Jira ticket acceptance criteria
2. Create test cases covering:
   - Happy path scenarios
   - Edge cases
   - Error handling
   - Boundary conditions
   - Security scenarios
3. Format each test case with:
   - Test ID
   - Description
   - Preconditions
   - Steps
   - Expected results
4. Prioritize by risk level

Ticket URL: [PASTE_TICKET_URL]
description: Generate comprehensive test cases from requirements

title: Customer Issue Diagnosis
content:
Help diagnose a customer issue:

1. Gather issue details:
   - Error messages
   - Steps to reproduce
   - Environment information
   - Recent changes
2. Search knowledge base for similar issues
3. Analyze potential causes:
   - Configuration issues
   - Known bugs
   - User error
   - Environment-specific problems
4. Recommend troubleshooting steps
5. Suggest escalation path if needed

Issue Description: [DESCRIBE_ISSUE]
description: Systematic customer issue diagnosis and resolution

title: Data Pipeline Documentation
content:
Document a data pipeline:

1. Describe the pipeline components:
   - Data sources
   - Transformations
   - Destinations
   - Scheduling
2. Create documentation including:
   - Architecture diagram (text-based)
   - Data flow description
   - Dependencies
   - Error handling
   - Monitoring and alerts
3. Format for technical reference

Pipeline Name: [PIPELINE_NAME]
description: Create technical documentation for data pipelines

title: Extract Brand Colors
content:
Extract brand colors from a website:

1. Use web_search or fetch the website
2. Identify:
   - Primary brand colors (HEX, RGB)
   - Secondary/accent colors
   - Background colors
   - Text colors
3. Create a color palette summary
4. Suggest complementary colors for designs

Website URL: [URL]
description: Extract and document brand color palette from website

title: Weekly Status Update
content:
Generate weekly status update:

1. Gather data from Jira, Confluence, and other sources
2. Summarize:
   - Accomplishments this week
   - Key metrics/progress
   - Risks and issues
   - Plans for next week
   - Help needed
3. Format for stakeholder communication
4. Keep concise (1 page max)

Project: [PROJECT_NAME]
Week Ending: [DATE]
description: Create weekly project status update for stakeholders

title: Risk Register Update
content:
Update the project risk register:

1. Review current risks from Jira/Confluence
2. For each risk, document:
   - Risk description
   - Probability (High/Medium/Low)
   - Impact (High/Medium/Low)
   - Mitigation strategy
   - Owner
   - Status
3. Identify new risks from recent events
4. Recommend risk response actions

Project: [PROJECT_NAME]
description: Maintain and update project risk register

title: Requirements Analysis
content:
Analyze and refine requirements:

1. Review the provided requirements document/ticket
2. Check for:
   - Completeness (all scenarios covered)
   - Clarity (unambiguous language)
   - Testability (verifiable acceptance criteria)
   - Feasibility (technically achievable)
   - Consistency (no contradictions)
3. Identify gaps and questions
4. Suggest improvements and clarifications

Requirements Source: [TICKET_OR_DOC_LINK]
description: Analyze requirements for completeness and clarity

title: Integration Design Review
content:
Review system integration design:

1. Analyze the proposed integration:
   - Source and target systems
   - Data flow direction
   - Integration pattern (sync/async, push/pull)
   - Authentication mechanism
2. Evaluate:
   - Security considerations
   - Performance implications
   - Error handling strategy
   - Monitoring approach
3. Identify risks and recommend improvements

Integration Description: [DESCRIBE_INTEGRATION]
description: Review and improve system integration designs
